page.title: 02Newborough..The Countryside
page.content:
The area consists of a mixture of{ {agricultural land}and{woodland}with surrounding gentle hills.
The woodland is what remains of{ {Needwood Forest}- mainly conifers, oak, ash, sycamore, horse chestnut & holly. It also shelters varied wildlife including pheasant, foxes, wood pigeons and occasional badgers.
Cultivated land is hedged mainly with hawthorn, holly, blackthorn, elder, blackberry, honeysuckle & bracken.
Roads in the area - from B-roads to minor roads - are tarmacadam, and the new roads, unlike the original lanes, are reasonably straight!
The{Tourist Board}also promote the whole area as the{'Vale of the Trent'.
